meanings.definition: Liberalizers: those who promote or support liberal policies or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The liberalizers in the group advocated for equal rights for all.
meanings.sent2: Many liberalizers believe in the importance of freedom of speech.
meanings.sent3: The liberalizers at the meeting were excited to discuss progressive changes.
meanings.sent4: Her parents were the liberalizers of the family, always fighting for social justice.
meanings.sent5: The liberalizers worked tirelessly to bring about positive change in society.

meanings.definition: Liberalizers: to make more liberal or open-minded.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to liberalize her friends' views on different cultures.
meanings.sent2: The school curriculum was liberalized to include diverse perspectives.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would liberalize his cat's opinion on catnip.
meanings.sent4: The experience abroad really liberalized her outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The documentary aimed to liberalize viewers' understanding of global issues.

meanings.definition: Liberalizers: becoming more liberal or open-minded.
meanings.sent1: After the workshop, she felt more liberalizers in her thinking.
meanings.sent2: The company's culture became more liberalizers over time.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him about his liberalizers fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: The city's atmosphere was filled with a liberalizers vibe.
meanings.sent5: The book inspired a sense of liberalizers exploration in the readers.
